org.araneaframework.framework
Interface MessageContext

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable, UpdateRegionProvider
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardMessagingFilterWidget
public interface MessageContext
extends UpdateRegionProvider

A context for adding messages to a central pool of messages for later output with a consistent look.

A good example is StandardMessagingFilterWidget. It registers a MessageContext in the environment and if a childservice needs to output a message which should have a consistent look (location on the screen, styles etc.) it adds the message via showMessage(String,String).

A widget can use the MessageContext from the environment to output the accumulated messages.

Permanent messages should stay in MessageContext until explicitly cleared, other messages should be cleared after the user has seen them once.

Author:
"Toomas RÃ¶mer" , Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org), Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org)

Method Detail

showMessage

void showMessage(String type,
                 String message,
                 Object... params)
Adds the message of given message type to the messages to be shown the user. The message will be removed from this context before the next request.

Parameters:
type - The type of messages that the given message will be bound to. Can be one of, but is not limited to the ones defined MessageContext.
message - The message text to show. Can be a label that will be localized before displaying.
params - Optional parameters for the message label.

showMessage

void showMessage(String type,
                 MessageContext.MessageData messageData)
Adds the messageData of given message type to the messages to be shown the user. The message will be removed from this context before the next request.

Parameters:
type - The type of messages that the given message will be bound to. Can be one of, but is not limited to the ones defined MessageContext.
messageData - The data object describing the message to show.
Since:
2.0

hideMessage

void hideMessage(String type,
                 String message)
Removes the message from the messages of given message type.

Parameters:
type - The type of messages where the given message will be removed from. Can be one of, but is not limited to the ones defined MessageContext.
message - The message to remove. When it's a label to localize, the label parameters will be ignored.
Since:
1.1

hidePermanentMessage

Parameters:

clearAllMessages

void clearAllMessages()

getMessages

Map<String,Collection<MessageContext.MessageData>> getMessages()
Returns all messages as a Map. The keys of the Map are the different message types encountered so far and under the keys are collections of messages associated with that type.

A child service should do as follows to access the messages 

 MessageContext msgCtx = getEnvironment().requireEntry(MessageContext.class);
 Map<String, Collection<MessageData>> map = msgCtx.getMessages();
 Collection<MessageData> list = map.get(MessageContext.ERROR_TYPE);

The map could be null, if this service was not used. The collection is null, if no messages of that type been added to the messages.

Returns:
A map of message types and their corresponding messages.
Since:
1.1

getResolvedMessages

Map<String,Collection<String>> getResolvedMessages(LocalizationContext locCtx)
Returns all messages after resolving their values. Otherwise similar to getMessages().

Parameters:
locCtx - The localization context that is used for resolving.
Returns:
A map of message types and their corresponding values.
Since:
2.0
